topic.title: How does ZeroNet manage P2P on mobile networks ?
topic.body: Usually to do P2P you use UPNP IGD which ZeroNet uses however this technology doesn't work on mobile networks yet ZN does. Basically, how does that part work ?

1557648920_1Mj79LYD98Up6EBBtETMhWaLUk4uP.body: Why don't you copy-paste the zite folder ? Anyways, if you want all the files including those optional that you don't already have, there's an option to download and share the whole zite in its Zero menu ( The Zero in the top right corner).

1558097107_1AuVGLDjx35QmYxQ69dzgtuuYxpBW.body: ... Really any zite ? There's gotta be a blacklist, right ? XD

1557968684_17bfQv5PQW9FZ4akChr7ECfqP2SKu.body:
> [sharer](#comment_51_17ArNJgy6YwDKjMSsnx1es2ie5jLHJbD9P): Do you like mine?

WTF there are ads on it ? What kindda server cost do you need to cover ??

1555954035_1gyp68xGQMYy4CBjedTvYU6xsyxPv.body: Just use the ZeroChat tutorial lmao.

1558666037_1BGbyM8MfxFyJ8xwDkApNMexZTGAk.body: Dunno, I thought about trying to create one. The transaction aspect isn't too complicated but making stuff secure is.

> [quantumworld](#comment_460_1AdWXZdPUimpXoGNXUBde2CHR7gLf4onxE): Posting a link to a Tor site to do the crypto transaction may work out well.I am sure some one will code something that will work on a p2p platform. I am clueless how it could be done that would make it secure.

Not a good idea imo, if illegal stuff were to be sold, the serv could get raided. I'm gonna think of a way to do this but beforehand I have to learn how cryptocyrrencies work lol.

1558691316_15Gk4wzjyNbPU3JZ31UnqMM3CMrX8.body: You mean fuck the people who abuses cookies, lie to you and sell every detail of your life that's linked to IT stuff such as social media right ? I get that some of you hate the EU but you're just being dishonest ungrateful fucks here. The GDPR move CLEARLY benefits us.

1557261503_17ArNJgy6YwDKjMSsnx1es2ie5jLH.body:
> [quantumworld](#comment_472_1AdWXZdPUimpXoGNXUBde2CHR7gLf4onxE): Thats cool. I have already removed 30+ mining sites that have sucked over 99% of my cpu usage and put on my ban list. I have a 4 core system here and I just wont put up with a cpu sucker being shared from my system to others. An option to use it is fine. I need a 64 core system with minimum of 128 gig of ram for the stuff I am trying to do now.

Mind sharing the list ?

1559424911_17ig1FpuxY5dVESXxUpYN88oxLzZN.body: I'm not sure I understood the general idea, can someone tl:dr me what the idea is ?

1559590587_1P4KkC3wa5xtGD8m2MoBTf5p69G3X.body:
> [leftside](#comment_776_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm): try this: http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1BLueGvui1GdbtsjcKqCf4F67uKfritG49/1KuwwnkAtVrfnyhv8pyGRxLqzNZbEkJt2u/1556750255

"User not found or muted" Eh ?

> [leftside](#comment_777_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm): Did u mute @Lola?Plz check 'Manage blocked users and sites' in 3-dot menu in the left top of ZeroHello.

"Your mute list is empty" nah, that's gotta be something else. Maybe it's a bug on the app ? I'll try it on my laptop.

EDIT: Turns out it fixed itself on its own, eh.

1559768099_149EPBN4hQRpwj5TcoPETepnoXHCU.body:
> [sheendocks](#comment_38_1P4KkC3wa5xtGD8m2MoBTf5p69G3Xr4aCU): Keep the porn and child abuse off the zite if possible.

... Child abuse is either porn or child explotation to create 2 vids per day for other kids like there already is on classical YT and idk about deleting that second part lmao. 

> [kaha](#comment_1_12ouvPM3GngqDrmrhY6PfAy1MvA8dZDFCj): Unable to block pornography in the zeronet

The site owner can and also can also choose mods to delete stuff.

1559892958_1NFEZa8hNrGfpw1EK4yRPWVquQJi5.body: Just put your ZN on an USB key.

1558494867_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJV.body: I can't even get my Tor to work on my ZN. It works by itself but ZN won't connect to it anymore :/

> [leftside](#comment_780_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm): Try this: sudo service tor restart; ./ZeroNet.sh --tor_proxy localhost:9050 --tor_controller localhost:9051 --ui_port 43110;

I'm on Windows but basically what I'll have to do is restart Tor Browser ( Which control my Tor service ) and then start ZN from CMD with the args you mentionned, I'll try that, ty.

1559881033_1JRYQyzmizvMoyErQBW2qZd5FNiWe.body:
> [sceptique](#comment_7_1TWoxhM5cZiLpzybpLyYtEsskuGJ9yVhv): What are the big advantages it has compared to other ? (scope: the language itself, not the libraries around or the amount of help on stackoverflow ^^)

It's simple AF, you can do server-side stuff easily and it is the go-to language for scripting meaning you wanna have a Py2 and a Py3 installed if you're computer-savy even if you don't code in this language, on top of my head.

1560245103_191qyhaRxXEx1bdtG65iQvFddtXBj.body:
I've already spent hours reading the doc and it does NOT explain what to_table does, why to_json_table is needed or how any of this works, the only thing the dbschema doc shows is ONE commented exemple and a list of commands with no good explanation. 

I figured that apparently the db modifications only happens when data is added, not modified. This is both dump ( imo) and untold. It took me hours to figure all of this out, all that was needed was one line. First thing I do after my current project is try to make the doc better. 

In the meanwhile I guess I'll have to discover stuff by myself while people tell me to read the entire docs I've already read for hours whenever there's something I don't understand. 

> [pubg](#comment_49_1PqrpogAwPjPf9T7bJjWWAjzTaRQcXLYCR): Doc about zeronet

As for 

> [lola](#comment_123_1KuwwnkAtVrfnyhv8pyGRxLqzNZbEkJt2u): +1 and you will find more information in this section (/1DocsYf2tZVVMEMJFHiDsppmFicZCWkVv1/site_development/dbschema_json/)[/1DocsYf2tZVVMEMJFHiDsppmFicZCWkVv1/site_development/dbschema_json/] [...]

Yeah mb I didn't consider giving the whole file because it was syntaxically correct but it could have helped.

1561540663_1FqSXCYG7aTFqtAbtRi1qQ7ZEprgp.body:
> [trustmenot](#comment_8_1FqSXCYG7aTFqtAbtRi1qQ7ZEprgpdEd75): Actually not much, I just wrote "hack" in the search function :P . Anyhow, I was looking at ZeroTalk and I saw various topics, but not that many about software hacking, penetration tests, network related topics as I expected. I thought that - after porn - these would have been the main topics, while obviously they are not.

It's easier to get info on this on the Clearnet. Here the IT guys mainly talk about Zites development.

1562068614_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body: China blocked zeronet.io but they may still connect to ZN as, AFAIK, they did not block the trackers. Russia didn't block anything AFAIK, North Korea stuff is blocked by default.
